titleStmt.title: Nevves from Virginia The lost flocke triumphant. With the happy arriuall of that famous and worthy knight Sr. Thomas Gates: and the well reputed & valiant captaine Mr. Christopher Newporte, and others, into England. With the maner of their distresse in the Iland of Deuils (otherwise called Bermoothawes) where they remayned 42. weekes, & builded two pynaces, in which they returned into Virginia. By R. Rich, Gent. one of the voyage.
titleStmt.author: Rich, Richard, fl. 1610.

titleStmt.title: Nevves from Virginia The lost flocke triumphant. With the happy arriuall of that famous and worthy knight Sr. Thomas Gates: and the well reputed & valiant captaine Mr. Christopher Newporte, and others, into England. With the maner of their distresse in the Iland of Deuils (otherwise called Bermoothawes) where they remayned 42. weekes, & builded two pynaces, in which they returned into Virginia. By R. Rich, Gent. one of the voyage.
titleStmt.author: Rich, Richard, fl. 1610.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Edw: Allde, and are to be solde by Iohn Wright at Christ-Church dore,

notesStmt.note: The first leaf bears signature-mark "A" and a woodcut of a ship; the last leaf is blank.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
